}} ' Kathrin Romary "Kate" Beckinsale' (born 26 July 1973)
is an English actress. After some minor television roles, she made her film
debut in [[Much Ado About Nothing (1993 film)|Much Ado About Nothing]] (1993)
while still a student at Oxford University. She then appeared in British costume
dramas such as [[Prince of Jutland]] (1994), [[Cold Comfort Farm (film)|Cold
Comfort Farm]] (1995), [[Emma (1996 TV film)|Emma]] (1996), and [[The Golden
Bowl (film)|The Golden Bowl]] (2000), in addition to various stage and radio
productions. She began to seek film work in the United States in the late 1990s
and, after appearing in small-scale dramas [[The Last Days of Disco]] (1998) and
[[Brokedown Palace]] (1999), she had a break-out year in 2001 with starring
roles in the war film [[Pearl Harbor (film)|Pearl Harbor]] and the romantic
comedy [[Serendipity (film)|Serendipity]]. She built on this success with
appearances in the biopic [[The Aviator (2004 film)|The Aviator]] (2004) and the
comedy [[Click (2006 film)|Click]] (2006).

Beckinsale became known as an action star following an appearance in 2003's
[[Underworld (2003 film)|Underworld]] and has since starred in many action
films, including [[Van Helsing (film)|Van Helsing]] (2004), [[Underworld:
Evolution]] (2006), [[Whiteout (2009 film)|Whiteout]] (2009), as well as
[[Contraband (2012 film)|Contraband]], [[Underworld: Awakening]], and [[Total
Recall (2012 film)|Total Recall]] (all in 2012). She also makes occasional
appearances in smaller dramatic projects such as [[Snow Angels (film)|Snow
Angels]] (2007), [[Winged Creatures (film)|Winged Creatures]] (2008), [[Nothing
but the Truth (2008 American film)|Nothing but the Truth]] (for which she earned
a Critic's Choice Award nomination in 2008), and [[Everybody's Fine (2009
film)|Everybody's Fine]] (2009). She will next appear in the legal drama The
Trials of Cate McCall.

Born and raised in London, Beckinsale's parents are actor Richard Beckinsale
(1947â1979) and actress Judy Loe. She had an eight-year relationship with Welsh
actor Michael Sheen from 1995 until 2003; they have one daughter. She married
American film director Len Wiseman in 2004 and relocated to Brentwood, Los
Angeles. Publications such as [[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]] and [[People
(magazine)|People]] have repeatedly included Beckinsale in their annual rankings
of the world's sexiest and most beautiful women. She has worked occasionally as
a model in television and print campaigns to promote Gap denim, Diet Coke,
Absolut Vodka, and Lux shampoo.
